requirements.summary: Show a 5-line message under the existing “Good choice ❤️” confirmation heading after clicking Yes, using a simple fade-in animation without layout shift or scrolling issues.
acceptanceCriteria: Before clicking “Yes”, the page remains unchanged (question + subtitle + two buttons, with evasive “No”).
After clicking/tapping “Yes”, both buttons are hidden and the heading “Good choice ❤️” remains visible exactly as-is.
Under “Good choice ❤️”, the 5 provided lines appear in order, each on its own line.
The 5-line message uses a simple fade-in animation (no typing animation), and the animation does not cause layout shift or accidental scrolling on mobile/tablet (including iPad Chrome).
No meme image or photo is introduced as part of this change.

file_operations.description: In the confirmed state UI, keep rendering the existing heading text exactly “Good choice ❤️”, and add a new block beneath it that renders the 5 required lines as separate lines (e.g., stacked text elements). Apply a simple opacity-only fade-in class to the new 5-line block (not a typewriter effect), and ensure the animation uses transforms/opacity only (no reflow-triggering properties) to avoid layout shift or accidental scrolling on mobile/tablet.

Add a dedicated utility animation for a simple fade-in (opacity-only, optionally with a non-layout-affecting transform like translateY) intended for the new 5-line message. Use this instead of the existing scale-based fade-in if needed to better satisfy the no-layout-shift/no-accidental-scroll constraint.
